!Text: Changes the clock's time format to 24 hours.

!Note: Title of the settings advanced tab

!Text: Shows the clock speeds of all cores not just the first.
Shows the sidebar in the Alt + Tab menu.
Makes the sidebar always on top of other windows.
Sets the background color to your Windows color settings.
The kbps or kBps threshold at which bandwidth received alerts occur. Use 0 to disable.
The kbps or kBps threshold at which bandwidth sent alerts occur. Use 0 to disable.
Makes mouse events pass through the window. Note this will prevent any interaction with the sidebar.
Removes the extra space at the top of the sidebar.
Shows the percentage load of all cores.

!Note: Title of the settings customize tab

!Text: Format of the date below the clock.
Which edge the sidebar will dock to.
Shows extra drive details as text.

!Text: Click a row to edit its settings.

!Note: Title of the settings monitors tab

!Text: Time between polling for data in milliseconds.
Reserves space in the work area for the sidebar.
Round all decimal values to the nearest integer.
Runs the app when you first log in.
Which screen the sidebar will be on.
Shows drive read and write speeds if drive details is enabled.
Shows load percent, used space, and free space if drive details is enabled.
Shows the tray icon in the taskbar. This is sometimes required.
Width of the sidebar in pixels.
The temperature threshold at which alerts occur. Use 0 to disable.
Scale of all windows and UI components.

!Text: Shows bandwidth in bytes instead of bits per second.

!Text: The percentage threshold at which used space alerts occur. Use 0 to disable.
Temperatures for sensors and alerts will be in Fahrenheit instead of Celcius.
Clock speeds will be in GHz instead of MHz.
Use the sliders and textboxes to move the sidebar to the correct position.
